intro: Serapias levantina subsp. feldwegiana, commonly known as the Feldweg's sandwort, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Rockcress (Capparaceae), characterized by its small, often yellow or orange flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, thriving in arid and semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually basal, linear, and covered in a fine layer of white hairs, which help reduce water loss. The flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, often blooming in early spring.
